009
010package Ch25_SIFT;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.color.sets.ColorEnumeration.getColors;
013import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
014
015import java.awt.Color;
016import java.awt.Font;
017import java.awt.Shape;
018import java.awt.geom.AffineTransform;
019import java.awt.geom.Line2D;
020import java.awt.geom.QuadCurve2D;
021import java.util.List;
022
023import ij.IJ;
024import ij.ImagePlus;
025import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
026import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
027import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
028import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
029import imagingbook.common.color.sets.BasicAwtColor;
030import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
031import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
032import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
033import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ColoredStroke;
034import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ShapeOverlayAdapter;
035import imagingbook.common.math.VectorNorm.NormType;
036import imagingbook.common.sift.SiftColor;
037import imagingbook.common.sift.SiftDescriptor;
038import imagingbook.common.sift.SiftDetector;
039import imagingbook.common.sift.SiftMatch;
040import imagingbook.common.sift.SiftMatcher;
041import imagingbook.sampleimages.SiftSampleImage;
042
043/**
044 * <p>
045 * This ImageJ plugin demonstrates the use of the SIFT detection and matching
046 * framework. The plugin takes a single image, which is assumed to be
047 * composed of a left and right frame. The input image is split horizontally,
048 * then SIFT detection and matching is applied to the two sub-images.
049 * The input image is always converted to grayscale before SIFT feature detection
050 * is performed.
051 * </p>
052 * <p>
053 * The result is displayed as a graphic overlay by connecting and annotating the
054 * best-matching features. When saved as a TIFF image the overlay is preserved.
055 * </p>
056 * 
057 * @author WB
058 * @version 2022/11/20
059 */
060public class Sift_Matching_Demo implements PlugInFilter {
061        
062        // matching parameters:
063        private static NormType DistanceNormType = SiftMatcher.DefaultNormType;
064        private static double MaxDistanceRatio = SiftMatcher.DefaultRMax;
065
066        // display parameters:
067        private static int NumberOfMatchesToShow = 25;
068        private static double FeatureScale = 1.0;
069        private static boolean ShowFeatureLabels = true;
070
071        private static double MatchLineCurvature = 0.25;
072        private static double FeatureStrokewidth = 1.0;
073
074        private static BasicAwtColor MatchLineColor = BasicAwtColor.Magenta;
075        private static BasicAwtColor LabelColor = BasicAwtColor.Yellow;
076        private static Font LabelFont = new Font(Font.SANS_SERIF, Font.PLAIN, 12);
077        
078        private static Color[] ScaleLevelColors = getColors(SiftColor.class);
079        
080        private ImagePlus im = null;
081        
082        /**
083         * Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image
084         * is currently open.
085         */
086        public Sift_Matching_Demo() {
087                if (noCurrentImage()) {
088                        DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(SiftSampleImage.RamsesSmall);
089                }
090        }
091        
092        @Override
093        public int setup(String arg0, ImagePlus im) {
094                this.im = im;
095                return DOES_ALL;
096        }
097
098        @Override
099        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {            
100                if (!runDialog()) {
101                        return;
102                }
103
104                final int w = ip.getWidth();
105                final int h = ip.getHeight();
106                final int w2 = w / 2;
107                
108                FloatProcessor Ia = IjUtils.crop(ip, 0, 0, w2, h).convertToFloatProcessor();
109                FloatProcessor Ib = IjUtils.crop(ip, w2, 0, w2, h).convertToFloatProcessor();
110                
111                SiftDetector.Parameters siftParams = new SiftDetector.Parameters();
112                // modify SIFT parameters here if needed
113                
114                // we use the same parameters on left and right image
115                SiftDetector sdA = new SiftDetector(Ia, siftParams);
116                SiftDetector sdB = new SiftDetector(Ib, siftParams);
117                
118                List<SiftDescriptor> fsA = sdA.getSiftFeatures();
119                List<SiftDescriptor> fsB = sdB.getSiftFeatures();
120
121                IJ.log("SIFT features found in left image: "  + fsA.size());
122                IJ.log("SIFT features found in right image: " + fsB.size());
123
124                // create a SIFT matcher and perform matching:
125                SiftMatcher sm = new SiftMatcher(DistanceNormType, MaxDistanceRatio);
126                List<SiftMatch> matches = sm.match(fsA, fsB);   // matches are sorted by decreasing quality
127                
128                IJ.log("Matches found: " + matches.size());
129                if (matches.isEmpty()) {
130                        return;
131                }
132
133                // --------------------------------------------------
134                
135                ColoredStroke matchLineStroke = new ColoredStroke(0.2, MatchLineColor.getColor());
136                ColoredStroke[] fStrokes = new ColoredStroke[ScaleLevelColors.length];
137                for (int i = 0; i < ScaleLevelColors.length; i++) {
138                        fStrokes[i] = new ColoredStroke(FeatureStrokewidth, ScaleLevelColors[i]);
139                }
140                
141                ShapeOverlayAdapter ola = new ShapeOverlayAdapter();
142                ola.setTextColor(LabelColor.getColor());
143                ola.setFont(LabelFont);
144                
145                AffineTransform trans = AffineTransform.getTranslateInstance(w2, 0);
146                
147                // add vertical separator between left and right image:
148                ola.addShape(new Line2D.Double(w2 - 0.5, 0, w2 - 0.5, h), 
149                                new ColoredStroke(0.2, Color.green, 5)); 
150                
151                // add SIFT markers, connecting lines and number labels
152                int n = 1;
153                for (SiftMatch m : matches) {
154                        SiftDescriptor dA = m.getDescriptor1();
155                        SiftDescriptor dB = m.getDescriptor2();
156                        
157                        // draw the matched SIFT markers:
158                        Shape sA = dA.getShape(FeatureScale);
159                        Shape sB = trans.createTransformedShape(dB.getShape(FeatureScale));
160                        ola.addShape(sA, fStrokes[dA.getScaleLevel() % fStrokes.length]);
161                        ola.addShape(sB, fStrokes[dB.getScaleLevel() % fStrokes.length]);
162                        
163                        // draw the connecting lines:
164                        Shape cAB = makeConnectingShape(dA, dB.plus(w2, 0));
165                        ola.addShape(cAB, matchLineStroke);
166                        
167                        // draw the numeric feature labels on both sides:
168                        if (ShowFeatureLabels) {
169                                String label = Integer.toString(n);     
170                                ola.addText(dA.getX(), dA.getY(), label);
171                                ola.addText(dB.getX() + w2, dB.getY(), label);
172                        }
173                        if (++n > NumberOfMatchesToShow) break;
174                }
175
176                im.setOverlay(ola.getOverlay());
177        }
178        
179        // -------------------------
180        
181        private Shape makeConnectingShape(Pnt2d p1, Pnt2d p2) {
182                double x1 = p1.getX(); 
183                double y1 = p1.getY();
184                double x2 = p2.getX(); 
185                double y2 = p2.getY();
186                double dx = x2 - x1;
187                double dy = y2 - y1;
188                double ctrlx = (x1 + x2) / 2 - MatchLineCurvature * dy;
189                double ctrly = (y1 + y2) / 2 + MatchLineCurvature * dx;
190                return new QuadCurve2D.Double(x1, y1, ctrlx, ctrly, x2, y2);
191        }
192        
193        // -------------------------
194        
195        private boolean runDialog() {
196                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());  
197                gd.addMessage("This plugin expects a single image composed of a left and right frame.");
198                
199                gd.addMessage("SIFT matching parameters:");
200                gd.addEnumChoice("Distance norm type", DistanceNormType);
201                gd.addNumericField("Max. ratio between 1st/2nd match (rMax)", MaxDistanceRatio, 2);
202                
203                gd.addMessage("Display parameters:");
204                gd.addNumericField("Number of matches to show", NumberOfMatchesToShow, 0);
205                gd.addNumericField("Feature scale", FeatureScale, 2);
206                gd.addNumericField("Match line curvature", MatchLineCurvature, 2);
207                gd.addEnumChoice("Match line color", MatchLineColor);
208                gd.addEnumChoice("Label color", LabelColor);
209                gd.addCheckbox("Show feature labels", ShowFeatureLabels);
210                
211                gd.showDialog();
212                if (gd.wasCanceled()) {
213                        return false;
214                }
215                
216                DistanceNormType = gd.getNextEnumChoice(NormType.class);
217                MaxDistanceRatio = gd.getNextNumber();
218                NumberOfMatchesToShow = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
219                FeatureScale = gd.getNextNumber();
220                MatchLineCurvature = gd.getNextNumber();
221                MatchLineColor = gd.getNextEnumChoice(BasicAwtColor.class);
222                LabelColor = gd.getNextEnumChoice(BasicAwtColor.class);
223                ShowFeatureLabels = gd.getNextBoolean();
224                
225                return true;
226        }
227
228}
